intro: Aphyllon tarapacanum, commonly known as the Tarapaca woolly plant, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of northern Chile. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its unique, woolly appearance. The plant has reduced leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. It is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments with minimal water availability. Aphyllon tarapacanum plays a role in local ecosystems and is of interest for its resilience and ornamental features.
